definition: hard to forget even after one's teeth fall out (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude

sentences.english: This afternoon, Smell the flowers , I watched A song to remember.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午，偷得浮生半日闲，看了《一曲难忘》。

sentences.english: Take a candid shot of WeiSheng shitting and he will give you the smell of a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 偷拍多多大便，他会放一生难忘的臭屁给你闻。

sentences.english: Unforgettable scenes flashed across his mind.
sentences.chinese: 一幕难忘的情景，立即在他脑海映现。

sentences.english: “I generally write little vignettes about daily occurrences I’d like to remember, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: “我一般习惯写点东西记下每天难忘的事，”她说。

sentences.english: This can turn a frustrating experience into the trip of a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 这能将一次糟糕的旅行转变为人生旅途中难忘的经历。

sentences.english: I have so many great memories from my time at Highbury and Emirates Stadium.
sentences.chinese: 我在海布里和埃米尔球场都留下了难忘的回忆。

sentences.english: He created many unforgettable characters in his novels.
sentences.chinese: 他在他的小说中创造了很多令人难忘的人物。

sentences.english: It was the first time I heart him talk, so I did afraid of that and unforgettable.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次听他说梦话，所以我很害怕也很难忘。

sentences.english: So it was definitely quite an experience.
sentences.chinese: 那场经历的确令人难忘。

sentences.english: He himself could never forget the three years he had spent in the earthly presence of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，追随基督的那三年光阴，是他永志难忘的。

sentences.english: It's small kindnesses like that of the Headmaster that you never forget.
sentences.chinese: 而校长那时的亲切关怀，我毕生难忘。

sentences.english: However, the most unforgettable in the history books still.
sentences.chinese: 不过，最令我难忘的还是史书。

sentences.english: This unique gift will make them unforgetable.
sentences.chinese: 这种别出心裁的“纪念礼物”，将会让他们终身难忘。

sentences.english: It was really the people I met on the island that made my Fijian experience unforgettable.
sentences.chinese: 在岛上所遇之人让我真正觉得这次斐济之行非常难忘。

sentences.english: I learned a lesson in the reading-room that I will remember all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我在阅览室里学到一个终生难忘的教训。

sentences.english: This camp as a real life-changing experience that I ill never forget.
sentences.chinese: 这次夏令营真实的生活体验令我永远难忘。

definition: lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
to miss/to yearn day and night
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
to remain fresh in one's memory (idiom)
to miss/to remember with longing/to long to see again
